messageBody:
Hi,
Following example might help you.

Write a javascript block to read the "Web Camera" from the specified span.
This can be as generic as in the example given below.

And to find font and other style properties from a css,
at first you need to identify the css class in use.
Using that class object you can find its font family, weight, and other properties.

Example is shown below:

<html>
<head>
<script>

function getText( spanId )
{
_elementSp = document.getElementById( spanId );
_innerHTML = null;
if( _elementSp )
{
_innerHTML = _elementSp.innerHTML;
} // if span found'

// debug
alert ( _innerHTML );

return _innerHTML;
} // function getText( spanId )
function readStyle( _id )
{
_el = document.getElementById( _id );
if ( _el )
{
_innerHTML = _el.innerHTML;
_style = _el.style;

crlf = "\n";
msg = _innerHTML + crlf + crlf;
msg += "Font : " + _style.font + crlf;
msg += "Font Family: " + _style.fontFamily + crlf;
msg += "Font Weight: " + _style.fontWeight + crlf;
msg += "Font Style: " + _style.fontStyle + crlf;
msg += "Font Size: " + _style.fontSize + crlf;
msg += crlf + crlf;

// debug
alert ( msg );
} // if element found
} // function readStyle( _id )
</script>
</head>
<body>
<br> <hr> <br>
<p id="para" style="font-family: Book Antiqua, Verdana; font-weight: bold; font-size: 20"
onClick="return readStyle( this.id );">
This is a paragraph "bold 20px Book Aniqua, Verdana" click me to find style
</p>
<br> <hr width="50" align="left"> <br>
<span id="sp" style="font:italic normal bolder 12pt Arial Black"
onClick="return readStyle( this.id );">
This is span - click to find style
</span>
<br> <hr width="50" align="left"> <br>

<span class="portlet-title" id="portlet-title-bar_92_INSTANCE_soeL"
onClick="return getText( this.id );">Web Camera</span> < click to get text
<br> <hr width="50" align="left"> <br>
<a href="mailto:arravinder@...">e-mail me</a>
</body>
</html>
